text:
In the PDF version of the Apache HTTP Server Documentation, many instances of the underscore character (_) are converted to a space character with underlining turned on.

The practical implication is that the documentation cannot be searched for any term that includes an underscore, making the PDF version much less useful.

For example, searching for "mod_cgi" using Adobe Reader 9 returns no results.

This should be fixed by using real underscores, instead of using typography to simulate that character.
creator: nate@natesilva.com
slive@apache.org
text:
Ugh! Care to help me figure out where in xml->xslt->latex->pdflatex->pdf this is broken? My guess is pdflatex, so I could conceivably try xml->xslt->latex->dvi->dvips->ps->acrobat->pdf to see if it fixed it.

But really, the pdf is intended mostly for printing. Other formats are much more browsable/searchable. So I'm not sure if it is worth fixing.
Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
creator: rbowen@apache.org

text: Apparently TeX changes underscore (_) to a space with a rule underneath when it thinks the font doesn't have underscores.  (From some googling for TeX and underscore.)  There's a LaTeX module that's supposed to help with this somehow, but a quick naive attempt to include it failed badly and I don't have the skills to debug it.
creator: poirier@pobox.com

text:
My vote on this would be that we remove mentions of PDF docs. If someone wants to step up and fix that build chain some day, that would be great, but we don't have a great demand for a PDF version, and we don't currently have anyone around who knows how to make this work.

Then, once those references are gone, we can close this WONTFIX.
creator: rbowen@apache.org
rbowen@apache.org
text: Reference to PDF docs removed. Closing WONTFIX.
